lib.runTest

Class ProgramExecuter

  • java.lang.Object
    • lib.runTest.ProgramExecuter

  • class ProgramExecuter
extends java.lang.Object
    this is class is used to execute the program once with given in input. standard output and error streams are bind together by default.
    Author:
    Neel Patel

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProgramExecuter

        ProgramExecuter(java.util.List<java.lang.String> input,
                java.lang.String cmd)
        create object with list of input string command. the command is not executed until the execute method called on the object.
        Parameters:
        input - list of string going to be provided as input to the program when executed.
        cmd - command to execute program.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> execute(long time)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        this method create the subprocess by command provided in constructor. method waits for subprocess to terminate. if the subprocess is not terminate in specified period of time then the process is terminated forcefully. return list printed by subprocess on output stream or error stream. return previous result immediately if the subprocess already executed ones.
        Parameters:
        time - time in milli seconds, the method wait for subprocess to terminate. value must be greater then 0.
        Returns:
        output of subprocess as list of string, null if process is terminated forcefully.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error occurred during creating subprocess.

      • stop

        void stop()
        this method stop the execution of subprocess forcefully if process is alive.

      • isAlive

        boolean isAlive()
        Returns:
        true if subprocess is alive, false otherwise

      • giveIn

        private void giveIn()
        give the input to the subprocess created by execute method. this method can be invoke from new thread. print strings on standard input stream of subprocess provided in constructor.

      • getOut

        private void getOut()
        get the output from standard output stream of subprocess and store in list output. method can be called from new thread.

      • getRunTime

        long getRunTime()
        return runtime of subprocess in milli seconds.
        Returns:
        runtime in milliseconds, -1 if process is not executed or terminated forcefully.

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
